title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 July 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:30 <pgmjsd> has joined #xwiki  
00:32 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
00:50 <CIA-114> Fabio Mancinelli master \* r77adaf7 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-eclipse/commit/77adaf70b3cb18c298d858aad544c961b1fb743f / (16 files in 4 dirs): Removed Common Navigator Framework and used a standard TreeViewer (+19 more commits...) - http://git.io/wFaNkw  
00:59 <polx> it doesn't seem so simple, sdumitriu... I still have a document where xwiki.getXWiki() fails but it is said to have programming rights with that. Either as admin or as guest.  
01:08 <sdumitriu> has quit  
01:15 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
01:18 <polx> @sdumitriu... $doc.hasProgrammingRights() seems not to depend on $doc... I want to know this about another page.  
01:18 <@sdumitriu> Yes, it's always for the current page  
01:18 <polx> Ok... so how can I see if another page has programming rights?

19:54 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
20:07 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
20:16 <+sburjan> I have a question, but it will sound a little bit silly. I want to know a method to download the latest snapshot of jetty+hsqldb from master, but after that I need to know the file name.  
20:17 <+sburjan> I am stuck with this, I am able to download it, but I don't want to use any hardcoded versions  
20:17 <+sburjan> and then I will need the file name so I can unpack it automagically  
20:17 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
20:21 <evalica> has quit  
20:21 <polx> has quit  
20:21 <+sburjan> basically I need to make my script aware of the version we have in our pom's on trunk  
20:24 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Look in the metadata xml  
20:24 <vmassol> sburjan: you should use the Maven puppet recipe  
20:25 <+sburjan> vmassol: I am using the puppet recipe, but that is not enough. I still need to supply a version when downloading the artifact  
20:25 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: I looked at http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/maven-metadata.xml and I saw that it says that the latest version is 3.1-SNAPSHOT, not 4.2-SNAPSHOT  
20:25 <@sdumitriu> Any idea why?  
20:25 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: which brings me to the question. http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/maven-metadata.xml  
20:25 <+sburjan> :)  
20:26 <+sburjan> I noticed this today, but forgot to ask  
20:27 <vmassol> no idea ATM  
20:27 <+sburjan> vmassol: that puppet-maven module is only good when you know the version you want to download, as a fixed value (it usess wget in the background).. and our snapshots are changing from 4.1 to 4.2 and also they have the unique ID number  
20:28 <vmassol> yes you need to know the version ofc  
20:29 <+sburjan> yes, but this won't make it fully automatic. when we move the trunk to 4.2, someone will have to manually change that. And I don't think you like this approach :)  
20:29 <+sburjan> or 4.3  
20:29 <vmassol> I don't understand  
20:30 <vmassol> if you have the maven build then you have the version  
20:30 <vmassol> how do you guess the version?  
20:35 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki
